abstract: Indonesian smuggler says Australian authorities stopped his boat at sea and paid him over $30,000 to return 65 migrants he was carrying to Indonesia; story, if confirmed, points to tightening of Australia's immigration policy under Prime Min Tony Abbott and potential violation of Austrailan, Indonesian and international laws governing smuggling, bribery and treatment of asylum seekers.
lead_paragraph: If the boat captain’s story is true, the incident may have violated Australian, Indonesian and international laws against smuggling, bribery and the treatment of asylum seekers.

headline.main: Australia’s Policy on Migrants Questioned After Smuggler Says He Was Bribed to Turn Back
headline.print_headline: A Smuggler’s Tale Fuels Concerns of a Hardening Migrant Policy in Australia

snippet: If the boat captain’s story is true, the incident may have violated Australian, Indonesian and international laws against smuggling, bribery and the treatment of asylum seekers.
